comments.author: Chef Magana
comments.content: Nice twist on your Saturday morning breakfast.

comments.author: Jennifer (Delicieux)
comments.content: Wow, this looks divine!  Perfect for those lazy Sundays when you feel like indulging.

comments.author: ben
comments.content: hmmmm and why would one to emulate a burger? odd .... i do enjoy this blog .... but .....

comments.author: Digital Photography Fan
comments.content: This looks sooo delicious....can't wait to try it this weekend!!!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content:
Hey BJ - it is meant to be a visual pun, not to actually emulate the taste or content of a burger. I enjoy playing with food this way, making reference to familiar ideas while putting a totally different spin on them.


Thanks,
Michael

comments.author: Lael Hazan @educatedpalate
comments.content: Oh my.... that is a "special" breakfast dish!  I'm gaining weight just reading the recipe.  How fun, what a great take on French toast.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: What's funny is I actually meant it to be dessert, but I can see why everyone thinks it is breakfast! Kinda makes me want to role with it and make it again with a fried egg instead of the whipped cream and maybe some maple smoked mushrooms....

comments.author: Lael Hazan @educatedpalate
comments.content: I realize that this is a dessert recipe; however, I look at this as a fancy brunch finale!

comments.author: Xiaolu @ 6 Bittersweets
comments.content: Oh my goodness, Michael.  I'm pretty sure I have drool on my chin now.  This looks and sounds ah-mazing.  If your works "in progress" are like this, I can't wait to see the finished work ;p.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: That works for me! What time should I be over?

comments.author: Trish
comments.content: Wow this sounds wonderful. I love brioche and I've never made it French-toast style..great idea.

comments.author: Lisa@ButteryBooks
comments.content: I would eat this for breakfast, lunch or dinner..maybe even for dessert.

comments.author: Mikaela Cowles
comments.content: It seems like one of your servings should feed at least two people.  I think the recipe should maybe read, "Serves 12 in tandem."  Looks absolutely delicious though and I'd say sharing a "work in progress," was definitely a good decision.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Thanks, Mikaela! Actually each piece of brioche is only a 2" square, so the serving is pretty tiny... it would definitely be very rich if they were large.
